meanings.sent1: Leaves left on the ground too long will moulder and turn into soil.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the old books in the attic began to moulder and fall apart.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich in the lunchbox started to moulder, much to the dismay of its owner.
meanings.sent4: Neglected dreams can moulder in the corners of our minds, fading away with time.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house stood silent, its walls slowly mouldering away in the wind.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that moulds
meanings.sent1: The sculptor was a skilled moulder, shaping clay into beautiful figures.
meanings.sent2: The moulder carefully crafted the intricate design on the metal vase.
meanings.sent3: The young artist showed promise as a moulder, impressing everyone with her talent.
meanings.sent4: In the workshop, the moulder expertly molded the hot glass into delicate shapes.
meanings.sent5: The toy factory employed many moulders to create the different parts of the toys.

meanings.sent1: The baker used a moulder to shape the dough into perfect loaves of bread.
meanings.sent2: The potter's moulder helped in forming the clay into elegant vases.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream shop had a special moulder for creating unique ice cream shapes.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter's moulder was essential for crafting the intricate details on the furniture.
meanings.sent5: The chef's moulder was used to shape the pasta into different forms for the dish.

meanings.definition: A person who makes moulds for casting metal or other materials
meanings.sent1: The moulder created precise moulds for the foundry to cast metal parts.
meanings.sent2: The skilled moulder designed molds that were used in the production of toys.
meanings.sent3: The factory hired a new moulder to improve the efficiency of their casting process.
meanings.sent4: The experienced moulder was sought after for his ability to create intricate molds.
meanings.sent5: The artisan moulder took pride in crafting molds that produced flawless ceramic pieces.
